item.title: 澳大利亚央行降息，对进一步宽松持谨慎态度
item.description: 澳大利亚央行周二自 2020 年疫情爆发以来首次降息，称虽然对进一步放宽政策的前景仍持谨慎态度，但在应对通胀方面已取得进展。【原文：Australia's central bank cut interest rates on Tuesday for the first time since the depths of the 2020 pandemic, saying progress had been made on inflation though it was still cautious about prospects of further policy easing.】

item.title: 智能电动车上市后，针对比亚迪的投诉充斥中国消费者门户网站
item.description: 中国一家知名汽车质量平台上充斥着对比亚迪（BYD）的投诉，原因是比亚迪为其大部分产品提供免费的智能驾驶功能。【原文：Complaints about BYD , over its move to offer free smart driving features across most of its line-up have flooded a prominent Chinese auto quality platform, many from customers who said they had overpaid for their cars.】

item.title: 消息人士称，汇丰在重组前裁减香港 40 名交易员
item.description: 据一位直接了解此事的消息人士称，作为该行全球重组的一部分，汇丰银行已在香港裁员约 40 名投资银行家。【原文：HSBC , has laid off around 40 investment bankers in Hong Kong as part of the bank's global restructuring, according to one source with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特拉华州法案将限制投资者诉讼，因为公司威胁离开该州
item.description: 特拉华州的立法者周一提议修改该州广泛使用的公司法，以限制股东诉讼，此前几家备受瞩目的公司表示可能会将其合法住所迁往另一个州。【原文：Delaware lawmakers on Monday proposed changes to the U.S. state's widely used corporate law that would limit shareholder lawsuits after several high-profile companies said they might move their legal home to another state.】

item.title: Dexus 将澳大利亚视为避风港，计划出售 20 亿澳元资产
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的写字楼业主德克萨斯公司（Dexus）周二表示，在地缘政治不确定的情况下，澳大利亚是投资者的安全港湾，该公司的目标是在三年内出售 20 亿澳元的资产，以应对商业地产市场的不景气。【原文：Dexus , Australia's largest office landlord, on Tuesday pitched the country as a safe harbour for investors amid geopolitical uncertainty, as it aims to sell A$2 billion of assets in three years in a faltering commercial property market.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局（FAA）运输主管称解雇了不到 400 名员工
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）的员工总数为 45,000 人，其中解雇的员工不到 400 人，运输部长肖恩-达菲（Sean Duffy）周一表示，由于近期接连发生飞机事故，人们对空中交通安全的质疑日益增多。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration fired fewer than 400 employees out of its workforce of 45,000, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said on Monday, as questions rise around air traffic safety amid a spate of recent plane accidents.】

item.title: 三星电子提名芯片高管为新董事会成员
item.description: 三星电子（Samsung Electronics）周二提名其芯片业务主管 Jun Young-hyun 和首席技术官 Song Jai-hyuk 加入董事会，这家科技巨头正寻求提高其陷入困境的半导体业务的竞争力。【原文：Samsung Electronics on Tuesday nominated its chip business chief Jun Young-hyun and Chief Technology Officer Song Jai-hyuk to join its board, as the tech giant looks to boost competitiveness in its struggling semiconductor business.】

item.title: 布伦特油价因里海泵站袭击事件上涨后回落
item.description: 布伦特原油价格周二早盘暂停上涨，此前一个交易日，俄罗斯的一个石油管道泵站遭到无人机袭击，导致来自哈萨克斯坦的石油流量减少。【原文：Brent crude oil prices paused in early trading on Tuesday after gaining in the previous session following a drone attack on an oil pipeline pumping station in Russia that reduced flows from Kazakhstan.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行决议公布前，美元摇摆不定，澳元略低于两个月高点
item.description: 周二，美元在两个月低点附近震荡，因为交易员们权衡了关税忧虑和美国降息的路径，而澳元即使在市场押注即将降息的情况下仍设法保持在两个月来的最高水平附近。【原文：The dollar wobbled near two-month lows on Tuesday as traders weighed tariff worries and the path to U.S. rate cuts, while the Australian dollar managed to stay close to its highest level in two months even as markets bet on an imminent rate cut.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，如果日产首席执行官内田离职，本田准备重启收购谈判
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周一援引熟悉谈判情况的消息人士的话报道称，如果日产汽车首席执行官内田诚（Makoto Uchida）下台，本田愿意重启收购谈判，组建全球第四大汽车制造商。【原文：Honda is willing to resume takeover talks to form the world's fourth-biggest carmaker, provided Nissan CEO Makoto Uchida steps down, the Financial Times reported on Monday, citing sources familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 伍德赛德公司和桑托斯公司面临盈利下滑；增长项目成为关注焦点
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的石油和天然气生产商伍德赛德能源公司（Woodside Energy）和桑托斯公司（Santos）的年度盈利预计将略有下降，投资者希望在关键增长项目执行风险挥之不去的情况下，进一步明确股息分配。【原文：Woodside Energy and Santos , Australia's top oil and gas producers, are expected to log a modest fall in annual earnings, with investors seeking more clarity on dividend payouts amid lingering execution risks to key growth projects.】

item.title: 三星电子注销价值 21.1 亿美元的自有股份
item.description: 三星电子（Samsung Electronics）在一份监管文件中表示，该公司已决定注销此前收购的价值 3.05 万亿韩元（约合 21.1 亿美元）的自有股份。【原文：Samsung Electronics has decided to cancel 3.05 trillion won ($2.11 billion) worth of its own shares that it had acquired previously, the company said in a regulatory filing.】

item.title: 独家报道特朗普打击低价值进口产品后，Shein高管寻求让投资者放心
item.description: 快时尚零售商Shein的执行主席唐纳德-唐（Donald Tang）周一在一封信中告诉投资者，尽管美国终止了对来自中国的低价值电子商务包裹的免税待遇并提高了关税，但 "增长依然强劲"。【原文：Fast-fashion retailer Shein's executive chairman Donald Tang told investors in a letter on Monday that "growth remains strong" despite the United States ending duty-free treatment of low-value ecommerce packages from China and hiking tariffs.】

item.title: 高盛将年底金价预期上调至 3100 美元
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）周一将 2025 年年底的金价预期从每盎司 2890 美元上调至 3100 美元，理由是央行需求持续增长。【原文：Goldman Sachs on Monday raised its year-end 2025 gold price forecast to $3,100 per ounce, up from $2,890, citing sustained central bank demand.】

item.title: 澳大利亚竞争监管机构建议批准维珍航空与卡塔尔航空结盟
item.description: 澳大利亚竞争监管机构周二表示，建议允许维珍澳大利亚航空公司（Virgin Australia）和卡塔尔航空公司（Qatar Airways）以综合联盟的形式在多哈和澳大利亚四个首府城市之间运营航班，为期五年。【原文：Australia's competition regulator said on Tuesday it was proposing to allow Virgin Australia and Qatar Airways to operate flights between Doha and four Australian capital cities under an integrated alliance for five years.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，负责审查马斯克 Neuralink 公司的 FDA 员工也被列入了被解雇的 DOGE 员工名单中
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，美国食品和药物管理局审查埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的大脑植入公司 Neuralink 的员工上周末被解雇，这是对联邦工作人员进行更广泛清洗的一部分。【原文：U.S. Food and Drug Administration employees reviewing Elon Musk’s brain implant company Neuralink were fired over the weekend as part of a broader purge of the federal workforce, according to two sources with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 作为成本节约计划的一部分，西南航空公司将裁减 15%的公司职位
item.description: 美国西南航空公司（Southwest Airlines）周一表示，该公司将削减约 15%的公司职位，即约 1750 个职位，因为这家美国廉价航空公司希望降低成本并精简组织结构。【原文：Southwest Airlines said on Monday it would cut about 15% of corporate jobs, or about 1,750 roles, as the U.S. budget carrier looks to reduce costs and streamline its organizational structure.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，澳大利亚伍德赛德公司正与至少三家合作伙伴洽谈路易斯安那州液化天然气项目
item.description: 多位消息人士告诉路透社，伍德赛德能源公司（Woodside Energy）已就其路易斯安那液化天然气厂的股权与几位潜在买家进行了谈判，其中包括东京燃气公司（Tokyo Gas）、日本 JERA 公司和沙特阿美支持的 MidOcean Energy 公司。【原文：Woodside Energy has held talks with several potential buyers of stakes in its Louisiana liquefied natural gas plant, including Tokyo Gas , Japan's JERA and Saudi Aramco-backed MidOcean Energy, multiple sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 美联储的沃勒：贸易和其他政策的不确定性不应阻碍利率走势
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，他的 "基线 "观点是，特朗普政府的新关税只会对物价产生适度影响，央行在制定货币政策时应尽量考虑到这一点。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said his "baseline" view is that the Trump administration's new tariffs will have only a modest impact on prices that the central bank should try to look through in setting monetary policy.】

item.title: 巴西中央银行宣布周二举行 30 亿美元回购交易拍卖会
item.description: 巴拉圭央行周一表示，将在周二上午举行的美元回购协议拍卖会上提供最多 30 亿美元，用于展期 3 月 6 日到期的债务。【原文：Bazil's central bank will offer up to $3 billion in a dollar auction with a repurchase agreement on Tuesday morning to roll over debt due on March 6, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 必和必拓钢铁和铜需求复苏，利润创六年来最低纪录
item.description: 必和必拓认为，中国经济复苏的迹象和央行降息恢复了对钢铁和铜的需求，但同时也指出了潜在的贸易紧张局势给全球经济增长带来的风险。【原文：BHP sees signs of economic recovery in China and central bank rate cuts reviving demand for steel and copper but flagged risks to global growth from potential trade tensions, as it logged its lowest first-half profit in six years.】

item.title: 亚洲央行蓄势待发，中国科技蓬勃发展，日本 GDP 高歌猛进
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，空客将因供应问题推迟A350货机的交付
item.description: 两位业内消息人士称，由于生产和供应链的延误，空中客车公司准备将其A350喷气机的货机型推迟一年投入使用。【原文：Airbus is poised to delay the entry into service of a freighter version of its A350 jet by up to a year following production and supply chain delays, two industry sources said.】

item.title: 高级官员称波音 "空军一号 "项目可能推迟到 2029 年或更晚
item.description: 白宫上周末强调了空军一号项目的延误，一位高级政府官员说，空军一号项目可能会进一步推迟到2029年或数年之后，理由是供应链问题和不断变化的需求。【原文：The Air Force One program may be further delayed until 2029 or years later, a senior administration official said, citing supply chain issues and changing requirements, after the White House highlighted delays in the project over the weekend.】

item.title: 研究显示，特朗普在社交媒体上发布的打动市场的帖子少于上一任期
item.description: 据美国投资银行摩根大通（JPMorgan）的一项研究估计，唐纳德-特朗普自连任以来，在社交媒体上发布的影响市场的帖子数量比他首次执政时要少。【原文：Donald Trump has so far sent comparatively fewer market-moving social media posts since being re-elected than during his first term in power, a study by U.S. investment bank JPMorgan has estimated.】

item.title: 消息人士称空客今年难以提高 A350 的产量
item.description: 业内消息人士称，空中客车公司正努力提高其A350喷气式客机的产量，因为它面临着来自美国精神航空系统公司（Spirit AeroSystems）的机身部件迟迟不能到达的问题。【原文：Airbus is struggling to increase output of its A350 jetliner as it faces ongoing delays in the arrival of fuselage parts from Spirit AeroSystems , industry sources said.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼在更多削减之前，需要对通胀下降有更大的信心
item.description: 美联储理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）周一表示，她希望在再次降息之前，能够更加确信今年的通胀率将进一步下降，尤其是考虑到特朗普政府的新贸易政策和其他政策的影响存在不确定性。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said on Monday she wanted increased conviction that inflation will decline further this year before lowering interest rates again, particularly given uncertainty around the impact of the Trump administration's new trade and other policies.】

item.title: 美联储主席哈克支持目前保持稳定的利率政策立场
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行行长帕特里克-哈克（Patrick Harker）周一对美国经济状况表示乐观，并称在央行继续努力降低通胀水平的同时，他认为目前没有理由改变利率政策。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Patrick Harker sounded an upbeat note on the state of the U.S. economy on Monday, and said he saw no reason to change interest rate policy right now as the central bank continued to work to lower inflation levels.】

item.title: 墨西哥龙舌兰酒制造商因美国关税威胁其业务而焦虑不安
item.description: 在美国征收 25% 进口税的威胁笼罩下，墨西哥龙舌兰酒制造商焦虑不安，因为他们花费数年时间建立起来的企业将面临倒闭的命运。【原文：With the threat of a 25% U.S. import tax hanging over them, Mexican tequila manufacturers are anxious that businesses they've spent years building will have the rug pulled out from under them.】

item.title: 诺瓦克称 "欧佩克+"不考虑推迟四月石油供应上调时间
item.description: 据俄罗斯 RIA 国家通讯社报道，俄罗斯副总理亚历山大-诺瓦克周一表示，欧佩克+产油国不考虑推迟定于 4 月份开始的一系列月度石油供应增加计划。【原文：OPEC+ producers are not considering delaying a series of monthly oil supply increases that is scheduled to begin in April, Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak said on Monday, Russia's RIA state news agency reported.】
